chapter.title: The Action menu
chapter.para: From the Actions menu, the user can access the Preferences and configure Servers. If the user's enthusiasm for GêBR has lead him/her to read the whole manual, then the user has probably used almost all available features found in these options. But just in case, the user will find the documentation for these options below.

section.title: Preferences
section.para: The details the user provides in the Preferences dialog box will be adopted as the default by GêBR. Specifically:

listitem.para: User name: will be used as the default for Author, when the user creates Projects, Lines and Flows.
Email: will be used as the default for Email, when the user creates Projects, Lines and Flows.
User's menus directory: will be the default directory where GêBR's Menus are maintained (mnu files).

mediaobject.caption: Preferences menu opens a dialog box where the user edits the user's name, e-mail, menu's directory and the HTML editor.

section.title: Maestro/Servers configuration
section.para: The Maestro/Servers InterfaceMaestroWorking machine has three parts:

listitem.para: Servers: choose the servers associated to the current Maestro.
GroupsWorking machinegroup of: configure the groups of Servers on the current Maestro.

mediaobject.caption: The Maestro/Servers Configurations interface is divided in three parts: maestro, list of servers and groups of servers.

section.title: Maestro
section.para: In the upper part of the ServersMaestro Interface (see ), there is an entry in which the user can put the desired machine to use as Maestro. A requirement is that the Maestro must be installed on that machine. The state of the connection between GêBR and the Maestro is shown by the right-side icon:

section.title: Servers
section.para: Once the Maestro has been selected and the connection has been successfully established, the user can associate working machinessWorking machine to that Maestro.
Each line in the Servers window represents the each machine associated to the Maestro. The lines have some columns:

listitem.para: AC: checkbox to activate or not the auto-connection to that server.
MPI: depicts whether the machine has support to MPIMPI.
Address: hostname or IP address of the working machine.
CPU Clock: CPU clock of the working machine.
Memory: total memory of the machine.

section.para: The user can add a new machine by clicking over New and entering the hostname or IP address of the machine.

section.title: Groups
section.para: The user can employ a subset of the machines associated to the MaestroWorking machinegroup of. This can be done through the creation of groups of machines.
In the bottom part of the Servers interface (see ), the user can create/edit Servers groups. The user must Drag and Drop the Server to create a group.
To create a group, the user needs to click over a server in the list and drag it to the + icon. A text box will be prompted for the name of the group. Groups with same names are not accepted.
